newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek shares climb 2.6pct to 1,727 -- new high.
newsitem.headline: Greek shares climb 2.6pct to 1,727 -- new high.

text.p: Greek shares were propelled to new all-time highs on Friday, topping the 1,700 level with remarkable ease on upbeat banks and large cap industrials.

"Investors are very aggressive in large caps and sentiment is better than ever despite sizeable price appreciations in the course of a few months," said Pantelis Mytilinios, an analyst at Sarros brokerage.
"The market is in good shape and I believe we are headed for the 2,000 level," the analyst added.
The Athens bourse benchmark index advanced 2.60 percent or 43.85 points to 1,727.70 from Thursday's 1,683.85 close.
It opened on a firm note at 1,691.36 in active trading in banks and other large caps and ground its way up to a historic high of 1,728.03 points, recorded a few minutes before close.
Banks firmed 2.65 percent, followed by industrials which posted a 1.85 percent climb. Other sectors were mixed.
Market watchers said concentrated buying in large caps was responsible for the rise which was seen extending towards the 2,000 level.
"This second leg of the rally is once again led by banks, but industrials and select mid-caps follow in tandem, said Andreas Skentzos, managing director at Condor EPEY, a financial services company.
He said the market's fast rise could be vulnerable to a sudden correction.
"I am somewhat concerned with the sharp rise in bellwether stocks. Currently, demand outstrips supply but a correction could be very sudden, impacting all other sectors too," Skentzos said.
"However, I do not think we'll see a sharp correction similar to that of last February because demand is broader and there are strong support levels at lower levels," he added.
Turnover was heavy at 32.4 billion drachmas on 7.7 million shares traded. There was a considerable amount of block trades in a wide range of stocks.
Advancing stocks led decliners 132 to 96 with 28 stocks unchanged on 256 traded.
